Saturam
Shanghai Nov. 10,
1934
DearestDebs:
estru
word
from you today.
and I guess I'll get none until
you pass
Wanhsien or some other air mail point.
Worked late, very late,
with George Sellett and am going to tie in again tonight at
seven oclock.
Mr .Dai
agreed
to toil tomorrow,
Sunday,
and
a1 so on Monday which is a
Chinese holiday,
being
the bitthday
of Sun Set Sam.
today for
lunch,
Saturday, and this afternoon am going
play tennis
with Ed Howard.
lunch and Gin Sue is ironing in one
corner of this room
out playing in the yard. Am going down
in a minute and
until
time to go to the club. They both look and are unusually
well though both are getting a littla lat on the
know it is bery good
chow at Wise inglande elas tou
- and Hebe eats the
enormous meals
imagipable. I did
not bhink
she would
ever finish
then
she
wound up
with three or
four pieces of pummello,
three bananas and
polished it all off with three
pieces of cheese. Of
course I am
glad because she looks
much
more better
to quote fier own words
feels
better.
a po Tan all horse that 1 may ba postale codina so got arava int
at the end of
next week and do not intend to slow up a bit on the
so with the single exception of the tennis this afternoon
which
figure will
actually help me
to cover more ground by being more fit.
Our Canton bound plane was hold up yesterday at Foochow by fog
and has been weather bound today also. Hope they may
Get away this afternoon
and complete their trip but the weather reports have not indicated any improve-
ment and it is just possible that they will not get through un til tomorrow. I
am awfully
glad that I did not try to
go as the loss of time would hate bad.
Am going down to the kids now and will finish this letter later.
Much late.
- fact monday

to report sincs then

properties.sfomuseum:description: Typewritten and handwritten letter from Harold M. Bixby to his wife, Debby Bixby, dated November 10, [1934]; includes observations of life in Shanghai and brief description of CNAC operations; mentions Mr. Dai [Enki], George Sellett, Max Lessner, Ed [Major Edward] Howard.
properties.wof:name: correspondence: Harold M. Bixby to Debby Bixby
